class_notes: Course Description: Insofar as no one escapes life alive, death is a universal phenomenon. Every civilization, perhaps every person, vies to inscribe death with significance. They also struggle to define death, as well as what constitutes dying. Indeed, science, medicine, religion, philosophy and law complicate such meditations. This course investigates these critical dimensions of demise by querying whether death is conclusive, irreversible or liminal.
course_description: This course investigates critical dimensions of demise by querying whether death is conclusive, irreversible or liminal.
